sentence.Network_en: He tramped hurriedly round the lake towards the garden.
sentence.Network_cn: 他匆匆地迈着沉重的步伐绕过湖边向花园走去。

sentence.Network_en: A blizzard was blasting great drifts of snow across the lake.
sentence.Network_cn: 暴风雪夹着大团的积雪吹过湖面。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English (denoting a pond or pool), from Old French lac, from Latin lacus 'basin, pool, lake'

entry.def: A lake is a large area of fresh water, surrounded by land.

example.ex: They can go fishing in the lake...
The Nile flows from Lake Victoria in East Africa north to the Mediterranean Sea.
example.tran: 尼罗河由东非的维多利亚湖向北流至地中海。

means.word_mean: 1. a body of (usually fresh) water surrounded by land
2. a purplish red pigment prepared from lac or cochineal
3. any of numerous bright translucent organic pigments

Sentence.sentence: The curtains were never drawn, even at night, so guests got a view of the lake and fountains outside which were lit up at night – a very attractive sight.

sentences.en: Lake Erie is filling with the heavy rain.
sentences.cn: 由于大雨, 伊利湖水正在上涨。

sentences.en: The windows open on a beautiful view of the Kunming Lake.
sentences.cn: 从窗口可以看到昆明湖的美景。

jushi.english: The river turns around the corner and suddenly opens out into a lake.
jushi.chinese: 河水转了个弯,忽然扩展成一片湖水。

jushi.english: The fence is intended to keep traffic away from the lake shore.
jushi.chinese: 这道围栏旨在阻止车辆在湖岸行驶。

jushi.english: The wind made the lake waters billow onto the beach.
jushi.chinese: 大风吹得湖水汹涌地扑向海滩。
